intro: Olyra capillata var. segregata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed olyra, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically in summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
